title: Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation: Career Cluster Knowledge and Skill Statements with Suggested Performance Indicators
subject: CTE

document.title: BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT Statewide Program of Study Framework: Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Career Cluster

3ADCE0F5916B4BEDBABE144A042C4193.description:
Trace the development of the hospitality and tourism industry in Oregon to
understand the overall structure

F4930C0F37B44D07BAC16B506F89ABB7.description:
Describe the strategies, policies, and regulations that the state government has
implemented (e.g., tax incentives, tourism promotion) to promote the hospitality
and tourism industry in Oregon

B977F4412469491F8232E5BCBDB64A21.description:
Compare/contrast management of different organizational structures including
independently owned, chain-affiliated, and corporations in the industry

F17D71BF8F2D42E796403130A48A8D9E.description:
Discuss the current trends in society (e.g., sustainability and eco-friendly tourism)
and how they affect hospitality and tourism in Oregon

D458911097844AD9A47ECB5F893CA6A7.description:
Describe the economic, social, cultural, and environmental contributions and
impacts of the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industries

940357DC957349CBAE04951F4C13724F.description:
Evaluate the nature and scope
of the Hospitality & Tourism
Career Cluster and the role
of hospitality and tourism in
society and the economy

EA01E04EE9054811A53CAE2A7483C9C7.description:
Identify key destination marketing organizations in Oregon that support
the hospitality and tourism industry (e.g., Travel Oregon, Oregon Restaurant
and Lodging Association, Oregon Destination Association, Oregon Coast
Visitors Association)

5063CA65EFA04B62A98D6B0906D1A3BE.description:
List the different special events offered throughout the state (e.g., ski resorts,
wine tasking, Pendleton rodeo, Shakespeare festival, etc.) and their implications
for the sector

B0C5D77635FE40868722171A8FE0EF70.description:
Identify national and state parks, regional convention centers, popular zoos,
museums, professional and collegiate sporting facilities, and theaters and other
cultural landmarks

67B64D0B046044BBB8CC7D54BD575DCB.description: Identify transportation options and their implications for travelers

894C0C773682455EBBAB573C7342570F.description:
Discuss seasonality in Oregon at the local, regional, and statewide levels, and
how different factors affect consumer motivation to travel to the state

E3D289A03EA74A5084AC9FB86BA82539.description:
Describe the key hospitality and tourism draws in Oregon (e.g., outdoor/urban
recreation, food and beverage, college/amateur/professional athletic events)

9E20CA358C274407B58B83E9B0E09E48.description:
Describe the hospitality and
tourism industry in Oregon

F1C939AF0D1146709B75D7614042B674.description:
Describe basic economic principles, including supply and demand, goods and
services, state/city/county taxes, international business, and economic resources

F5A43DFE70E24488AE8C69FC944B6840.description:
Explain the purpose of a budget, and differentiate between revenues, expenses,
profit, and loss

7FBC9A10D4FA42F0B066D3FFF3D3C3D6.description:
Explain the concept of cost-profit relationships (e.g., Cost of Goods Sold [COGS]),
competition, and economic indicators

A5A49BE6532D4BB19567CB971F2D2E98.description:
Describe purchasing activities to obtain business supplies, equipment, and
services (e.g., sourcing and procurement)

3A161842F71546989CD879171705EEF1.description:
Describe what key performance indicators (KPIs) are, how they are used
in different industries, and how they are tracked (e.g., daily, weekly,
monthly, annually)

7087D06146EF4B7FB906D15C0D63787A.description:
Define industry management terms including yield, yield management, no-show,
discount, inventory control, overbooking, and spoilage

72837F6368A742648A21CF8FB906DE00.description:
Demonstrate an
understanding of basic
economic systems and
financial management
practices and procedures

398AC17C0E2740BDAB2961661D639B36.description:
Explain how a theme might determine the types of products/services/
events available

8431D6B6A8F94D7DB4E001AF52BA7DC3.description: Explain the role history might play in developing programs/exhibits/events

F64A6E0B46EE4D5ABFC6923FECC256F5.description:
Summarize merchandising and retail outlet opportunities (e.g., trade shows,
networking events, guest rooms, theme parks) and describe retail opportunities
and branding strategies possible at each venue

9CAFF869BB3C40398DC5678DE4167C3E.description:
Research ideas needed to develop programs and/or products unique to
each venue

9A3FCF2CEE32464C8F705D7FE57E6D7C.description:
Describe how a point-of-sale system is used to manage market sales and
inventory for ordering

A33ADA7A58174AFDAA4F34DA9AA69990.description:
Analyze the merchandising,
program and product
potential for different
hospitality, tourism, and
recreation venues

F1DC1570C6A44BABB533004F535A25AA.description: Describe market segmentation and the variables that affect service costs

BF3443AF16034851BE50BC4DB18E9FBD.description:
Identify the elements of marketing (i.e., the four P’s: product, price, place, and
promotion) and how resources can be targeted toward different audiences
(e.g., addressing issues of diversity)

F737BC6B5235453185BB21199757F7E1.description:
Compare/contrast different marketing approaches (e.g., packets, e-commerce)
and strategies for making a sale

2566210F0ADA436EBDF433ABF25D92F5.description:
Describe the types of environmental and sustainability issues that apply in the
Hospitality & Tourism Career Cluster and strategies for addressing them

888957D980A34DC1B7FE3BA72B106093.description:
Describe destination marketing and how seasonality and loyalty programs
influence customer choices

1A360CF301E14AEAAC5E7F6A283E26CC.description:
Identify how the economy affects customer decisions and how products and
services can be tailored to address differing conditions of supply and demand

EC6CD63785784D94A78FF942DF80E170.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of marketing techniques commonly used in the
hospitality and tourism industry to sell a product or service (e.g., conducting
market research, developing products and pricing strategies, advertising and
distribution strategies, public relations, sales, and customer relations)

8B4B2FBAD7FF4969A14F909B33EB99F4.description:
Describe the key components
of marketing and promoting
hospitality and tourism
products and services

308D67EF331946D286421AAB94B70A35.description:
Describe what Customer Relationship Management (CRM) applications are
designed to do and demonstrate how they can be used

4F731E7421B64F5DBB7CD1FE59F09F13.description:
Recognize the personal needs of all guests, including those needing special
accommodations (e.g., language, health, Americans with Disabilities Act
requirements) and create a plan of action to meet the needs of these individuals

0C4B1261B69E4904A046EF4A68D753DC.description:
Identify retention and service strategies and proactive versus reactive techniques
in relation to guest experiences

92C5DF44C44B469DA4FC52FB6D6A9189.description:
Discuss ways to evaluate customer satisfaction and use feedback to manage and
enhance the guest experience, including procedures to resolve guest complaints

6C1249B84BFC492A8D6AEF4B77CAD3DC.description:
Define customer service and demonstrate terminology, concepts, and principles
associated with exceptional guest service

024AD6686A6F489887D4C70035E98065.description:
Define the qualities and characteristics of an effective service professional (e.g.,
ability to stay calm, listen, communicate effectively), and explain how customer
service affects a company’s bottom line

21C9D5449AEA4C57AE0BDC3FDBF07F84.description:
Demonstrate hospitality and
tourism customer service skills
that meet customers’ needs

A187D5B783F74E8CAF2C79CC7D11949D.description:
Create a plan to monitor traffic (e.g., vehicular, pedestrian, crowd) control issues
to manage congestion and describe how the plan might be tested to ensure its
functionality and improved to be more effective

D67DBA723DFD4B06988CBB1AAD4B801D.description:
Compare different ticket sales options, including methods for selling tickets, the
types and structure of admission ticket distribution channels, and factors to
consider when setting ticket prices

EC4CDDB0F37C4A61BA6606A111427D3A.description:
Identify a situation where the number of guests would need to be controlled,
and list how this would be accomplished

0E97FBAF60344881934F393A8DFE9115.description:
Describe how traffic control procedures can be used to facilitate movement of
people and vehicles (e.g., bollards, lines, parking attendants)

67544A638779478FA58238CD01263550.description:
Understand guidelines for access control to determine guest and group
admission procedures, and the use of tickets and membership for selective entry

5561E076FD3742BD80043A009C9D3BD1.description:
Describe the dangers that may arise when people or vehicles (e.g., cars, cyclists,
e-bikes/e-scooters, boats, skis/snowboards, snowmobiles etc.) congregate and
steps that can be taken to mitigate disasters

4E78A139C20D47D889F679A51EF05597.description:
Explain space utilization
procedures used to manage
and control people,
equipment, and vehicles in
diverse industry settings

AD04D86D52B343EE9915C280C91BF6D2.description:
Evaluate methods for equipment maintenance and repair to minimize down
time and guest displacement (e.g., creating work orders for fixing equipment,
rooms, etc.)

7DB73EB5C847431AB5FA9ACE2E8F7EB1.description: Create a plan to address the maintenance needs of a given facility

95BCF8B36665405B83C51E93B1D4B85C.description: List maintenance issues unique to tourist and recreational facilities

B74AA957555B4562851DCCD7BA3AC133.description:
Describe the types of maintenance issues that apply to differing venues and
how to determine if special training of personnel is required

7FEAAC01BF9D459886CF15C40C223FA1.description:
Determine the maintenance
needs for differing hospitality,
tourism, and recreation venues

8AF0086106A14A57BBCF4A1838B59B76.description:
Create communication and response plans to cope with hazards and emergency
situations applicable to the hospitality and tourism industries (e.g., fires, health
crises, missing child alerts, active shooters)

88ED6397603840918425F311795969D4.description:
Describe common safety and security issues for individuals and groups, explain
how to manage guests/customers facing a threat, and identify solutions to
minimize these risks

9ADBACFA964A49AA95ED5E6991BC664F.description:
Identify and list resources (e.g., company work protocols) that are available to
prevent, evaluate, and address environmental concerns, crime, human trafficking,
and terrorist situations

E4382F9EC13E444A966C54967810CB93.description:
Identify the steps that should be taken and resources commonly available
to address accidents or emergency health situations for self, co-workers, and
guests/customers

14D62F7EB6D44D249EA717700FBB6992.description:
Identify potential real and
perceived hazards and
emergency situations
and determine the
appropriate safety and
management measures

E0C80FD6DAEF40549602C347F9568D74.description:
Explain the role of federal and state governmental agencies (e.g., OSHA
regulations) in ensuring employees a safe workplace

E423044D3A4F414D943166F3333AA6C3.description:
Identify key rights of employees related to occupational safety and health and
employers and responsibilities in meeting these needs

81BA37579227428B84FE51D74EEC0D5F.description:
State the rationale for rules and laws designed to promote safety and health
in the workplace

3AEFD9E47C9F4C339B833BC51E44624A.description:
Describe and demonstrate adherence to legal policies relating to hiring,
harassment, and safety in the workplace

E3B9B6896ABC489A957D1FF3EDD0754D.description:
Identify and demonstrate adherence to ethical issues and concerns applicable
to the workplace and the ramification of not following them (e.g., low employee
morale, loss of guests)

A9005ABF1A324DFDBCF3AE553E807EE8.description:
Describe and demonstrate adherence to health, safety, and sanitation
regulations; practices and procedures applicable to the workplace; and the
ramifications of not following them (e.g., low health scores, loss of guest
amenities for failed inspections)

E4F670872D5A42B08CAC8698A2ED3117.description:
Describe employee rights
and responsibilities and
employers’ obligations
concerning occupational
health and safety

815172D33B614FFD876E42A227D8B8AE.description:
Summarize the educational skills, certifications, and/or degrees needed to
advance within a given career

EC1B0A4EAF214D219B84F0E5E2A2DD2E.description:
Exhibit the behaviors of early employment that will lead to career opportunities
such as appearance, attendance, listening skills, communication, teamwork,
enthusiasm, guest experience, and quality of product/work

99BD2FF1F5F44D3BB581DF9D5873D51D.description:
Describe the types of work experience opportunities that exist in the field (e.g.,
internships, apprenticeships, on-the-job training) and how one might access
these opportunities

F148A68FB7244045A63A74486EE1124E.description:
Identify educational training and credentialing requirements for entry-level
careers in the cluster, including those aligned with students’ personal interests

9A0B39F7AF8B435292CA93B84618A89D.description:
Describe a career pathway for transitioning from entry-level to skilled and
supervisory positions within the cluster

8CE9A427A1ED4F89B39D257D58B57C4E.description:
Research career opportunities in the hospitality, tourism, and recreation cluster,
statewide and tailored to regional contexts, and identify those aligned with
personal interests, aptitudes, financial, and career goals

630BB0A84B1F4AA38F27BA689881A83E.description:
Describe career options
and the means to attain
these options

DC496A6DEE3C4898BC627CB84818C2C7.description:
Identify the types of organizations that support clients in planning and booking
activities and meeting customer needs

BAAD897231954BFCA4F1BEC8B6B6F88D.description: Describe how individuals from different disciplines collaborate to deliver services

C2C14703F34B45E880E6E419CD27E838.description:
Identify the roles and responsibilities of employees in the hospitality, tourism,
and recreation industries (e.g., travel agents, hotel workers, restaurant staff,
amusement, and stadium staff)

D2E5272B7BE8453EA2289E0F96901206.description:
Identify the key sectors of hospitality, tourism, and recreation and differentiate
the goods and services produced in each

31EF0AB48A6D4D7D87EBE9909AEDFC48.description:
Describe the individuals and
organizations that collaborate
to provide services in the
hospitality, tourism, and
recreation industries
